Fields.DialogueText: Suffren, how are you?
Doing well Capitaine. Very well in fact.
Good to hear. How about the crew?
I am pleased to admit I was wrong. They have been performing their duties beyond my expectations.
*ALARM*
Looks like we're a well oiled machine.
One which the Morganas continue to test. They must be masochists at their core.
@BATTLE
Do you think we are making progress, Suffren?
Sir?

Fields.MenuText: In winning this war against the Morgana?
Are our battle skills improving?
As a people?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm less informed on the big picture, sir, but WE certainly are.
Slightly, but it is difficult to improve on perfection.
I'm not sure how to answer that Captain. You are vague.
Right.
How are you, Captain?
Hmmm? Fine, thank you for asking.
Captain, you seem somewhat melancholy as of late.
You don't need to worry. I've just been musing a bit too much.
Musings you intend to keep to yourself? Because those shoulders are adamantine.
No, that's not why.
Because the great Captain is above worry, meaningless discussion surrounding soft feelings, that the world is but a feather...
Okay, okay, I get it. Are you trying to be empathetic right now?
Trying, oui, and I am somewhat new to it so I would appreciate some assistance.

Fields.MenuText: Do you ever worry all of this fighting is chipping away at us? The good parts of us?
Do you ever get tired of the constant fighting?
Really, it's nothing.

Fields.DialogueText: There is plenty of good left. Any chipping serves to make us sharper.
Captain, I am a warship. I live for it.
You're lying aren't you? No need to answer.
I just get wrapped up in what our future will be sometimes. I'll shake it off.
*ALARM*
It looks like Morganas are in our future.
And that's all I see sometimes, those ships on the horizon.
Sir...
That's enough. We need to get to the bridge.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, may I ask you a personal question?
Of course.
When this war is over, what do you plan to do?

Fields.MenuText: Go back to my loved ones. Back to a life that doesn't involve fighting again.
Travel, meet new people, work towards something, stop fighting.
I'm not sure. I suppose I'll have a lot of options.

Fields.DialogueText: That sounds nice.
You do that now, albeit while fighting and maybe not meeting the best people.
Oui, you do.
What do you...
Do I plan to do? Didn't think out that question before you asked it did you?
I'm sorry, you could do...
Respectfully, sir, don't s'il vous plaît. I didn't intend to make you out to be insensitive.
Regardless, I have been.
I do not think about the future, not in any grand way. My time is now, sir, in war.
You're much more than a just a warship.
*ALARM*
I am - all us Belles are - but how many others will see that when they are at home, at peace with their loved ones?
We'll figure something out. Set a course for the Morgana ships.
Yessir!
@BATTLE
Suffren, we have received orders from Command.
If this is another non-combat mission, prepare yourself for a highly disgruntled ship.
We are to locate the island, Lintukoto.
I shot up to an eighty percent irritation level.
A lone ship claims to have returned from the island, which has seemingly vast supplies of oil and other natural resources.
Ninety percent.
Reports indicate the Morganas are aware of this, and have already dedicated vast resources to claim it.
Hmmm, back down to fifty percent.

Icebergs and rock formations make navigation, let alone combat, extremely complex and dangerous. We are to remove hostile Morganas from the area and relay the location of Lintukoto to an occupation force.
Is that all sir?
Yes.
I've settled right at around 25% disgruntlement, 10% because you didn't lead with the "destroy Morganas" part.

Fields.MenuText: Well, we do that on a regular basis.
You tend to stop listening to the "boring details" when I lead with that.
Has anyone described you as blood thirsty?

Fields.DialogueText: It's a good life we live.
I do not... You may have a point.
Not without having their point proven on the spot, sir.
*ALARM*
Let's brush them off. We have an island to find.
Yessir!
@BATTLE
Captain, we have reached the perimeter of our search area.
That is some thick fog.
Yessir, it is fairly common in this area.

Fields.MenuText: We aren't in a dire rush. Let's wait until it clears.
You could cut that fog with a knife!
Do you feel confident navigating through it?

Fields.DialogueText: That would be safe, sir.
It is thick, sir, but just short of reckless to navigate through.
Confident would be an exaggeration Captain.
*ALARM*
Morgana ships sir, coming out of the fog.
They look like they've taken some damage.
Possibly from the rocks or icebergs, sir, but it doesn't seem to be deterring them from attacking.
They're incapable of stopping, aren't they? Make ready.
Sir!
@BATTLE
I heard you and that piano were gaining a following down here.
Oui, but I can't say I particularly enjoy that.
Developing a little stage fright?
Annoyance, actually. I'm not a performer, and I don't revel in the attention.

Fields.MenuText: Then you shouldn't play so well.
Not even a little?
Well, it's not like they have a lot to listen to out here.

Fields.DialogueText: Merci, even if that compliment was a little clumsy.
Maybe a little, and I would like to keep the levels at "a little."
I'll take that as a compliment, because I'm sure that's what you meant, Capitaine.
The fog hasn't cleared at all.
It may have gotten thicker.
*ALARM*
These Morganas don't seem to be faring well in there.
Making ready to engage, sir.
Right, on my way up.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, sooner or later, we are going to have to begin the search.
You're right. It doesn't look like the fog is clearing. Strange.
Oui, but not unheard of. There's nothing magical about it.
I never said there was.
Of course not.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't!
Why? Do you think there is something else going on here?
What makes you so sure there isn't something supernatural occurring.

Fields.DialogueText: Yessir, I know.
Other than naturally occurring fog? No.
Science.
Has the crew been spreading rumors?
Do you really need to ask sir?
*ALARM*
Well, let's do our best to keep the rumors to a minimum. Tracking the Morganas?
Yessir. Ready to engage them.
Let's go.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I believe I have greatly increased our chances of navigating through the fog without incident.
Talk to me.
I have been running drills on a more efficient communication structure between primary ship systems. We can communicate and respond to hazards nearly instantly at battle stations.

Fields.MenuText: Well done. Let's get ready to move into the fog.
I would like a full report on all of the changes before we proceed.
I'd like to see some of these drills before I give them a stamp of approval.

Fields.DialogueText: Merci, Capitaine.
Already started. I will have them to you shortly.
Of course, sir. Whenever you are available.
How did you set all of that up?
Brevity, communication, and policy.
*ALARM*
I'll inform Command that we are ready to proceed.
I promise we will not look like these ships that have been coming out.
Speaking of, those Morganas are heading right for us.
Not surprising, sir. Ready for battle.
@BATTLE
How's the visibility, Suffren?
Sporadic, sir, but we are managing through the fog.
Under the circumstances, I'd say you're all doing exceptionally.
Sir! There is a small ship just ahead.

Fields.MenuText: All stop.
I don't see anything.
Where?

Fields.DialogueText: Yessir.
Due to the fog, sir. All stop.
Just ahead, sir, coming to a stop.
I see it... there's a person in there, waving. Looks like a life raft.
*ALARM*
Morganas closing range, sir!
Bring that person aboard quickly and prepare for battle!
On it, Captain.
@BATTLE
Did we manage to get that person aboard?
Checking, Capitaine.
Quite a show! Quite a show indeed!
Capitaine! I did not know or I would have prevented--
How did you get up here?
Oh, I know they don't look like much, but these two ole legs a mine get me from here to there.
You are not authorized to be here.
Suffren, it's fine. It's good to see you are okay. May I ask who you are and what you were doing?
Aleksi Ale, Captain of the Invincible Tide Tamer.
Was your ship destroyed by Morganas?
Morganas? No, you pulled it alongside, and it's fine. Oh, and fishing, that's what I was doing.
That little thing is your ship?
Oh my, look at the time! I am very busy and must make way. Good luck to you, explorers.
Capitaine.
I know, strange.
Sir, I am picking up a ship to port.
I see it, but I can't quite make it out.
Is that a Morgana ship?
Couldn't be. It's flying some sort of blue flag.
It's changing course and moving away from us.

Fields.MenuText: Follow them.
Let them go.
What do you think?

Fields.DialogueText: Sir, changing course.
Yessir, maintaining course.
I think we should pursue them, sir, at least until we can identify them.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Move to intercept.
Yessir!
@BATTLE
Suffren, I need to show you something.
What is it Captain?
Now, I'm only showing you this now because sooner or later you would find it on your own.
Sir?
Here.
What is this drawing? ...The Suffrettes!?
I don't think they meant to...
Is that Edmonson lying atop my piano!?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, it's a pretty good likeness. Didn't know we had artists on board.
I think it's Sanchez, actually. See, they drew that little mole he has.
Let's just dial it down a little.

Fields.DialogueText: You think this is funny.
I don't know about Sanchez's mole, I haven't seen his inner thigh before!
I'm going to kill all of them.
I've already put a stop to it and disciplined those involved.
*ALARM*
I suggest you inform them to stay well hidden.
First thing I told them. Let's go.
Sir.
@BATTLE
How goes the search?
Nothing yet, sir. We are continuing on our search grid.
What are you looking for?
Sir! Aleksi is back.

Fields.MenuText: How did you get here?
This is unacceptable.
Stand down, Suffren.

Fields.DialogueText: You let me on board, remember?
Well, I was in my ship, I waved to you all, and you pulled me on board.
I'm sorry, you're a jumpy lot.
You said you were leaving.
Did I?
I watched you leave.
Really? Huh, you know what? That was probably my brother.
*ALARM*
We'll deal with this later. Suffren.
Setting course for the Morganas, sir.
@BATTLE
Sir, the entire ship has been searched. We can't find this Aleksi.
I don't like this.
Permission to detain him on sight, sir?
Depends on where he's been. If he's minding his manners, I'm inclined to just observe.
Sir, I insist. We don't know his intentions.
He hasn't acted aggressively yet. Just remain extra cautious.
Sir.

Fields.MenuText: He's just an old man.
Who do you think he is?
This could be some sort of Morgana plot.

Fields.DialogueText: I doubt he is exactly what he appears to be.
I don't know, sir, but I don't trust him.
I doubt it.
*ALARM*
Back to work.
I see them, sir.
@BATTLE
Captain, it's that ship again, with the blue flag.
Correct me if I'm wrong, but that is a Morgana ship.
It appears so.
"Morgana"... so that's what you call them. Catchy.
Aleksi, sir.
Want to know what they call you?
We don't have time for this. Suffren, prepare to attack.
Wow, wait, why would you do that? They haven't attacked you.
You may have missed out on some current events, floating around up here. We are at war.

Fields.MenuText: Why wouldn't we attack them?
We have our orders. Don't interfere.
They're Morganas, that's why.

Fields.DialogueText: Because they are not attacking you?
Orders are important, very comfortable. You don't have to think.
Hmmmm, I've heard that before.
You're wasting your breath, Captain.
*ALARM*
A group of Morganas, closing fast.
The blue flag ship is retreating.
Let them go, bring us around.
@BATTLE
Aleksi, why do you keep showing up on my ship?
Uninvited.
I need a reason? Oh, right! I came... to warn you.

Fields.MenuText: Warn us about what?
Go on.
You're crazy.

Fields.DialogueText: Sir, he's crazy.
And you can cut the dramatics.
That's been obvious, sir.
These waters are saturated with fire and blood. You have awoken... Iku-Turso.
Capitaine...
That's what the scrolls say anyway, fire and blood. I'd wager it's all of the noise.
Who is Iku-Turso?
Tursas, Meritursas, the eternal Turso, an ancient creature that brings death and disease. Real mean, too.
Okay, that's enough.
*ALARM*
Morganas approaching, sir.
He will consume you all, Morgana included.
Prepare for battle, Suffren.
@BATTLE
Do you have a moment to talk, sir?
Is something on your mind?
Captain, you don't buy all of this Iku-Turso stuff, do you?

Fields.MenuText: Of course I do.
I'm not sure.
Of course I don't.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine, I think you may want to report to medical, as a precaution.
Sir, Aleksi is obviously out of his mind.
Sorry, I shouldn't have asked.
Ancient sea god or not, we are here to find an island and fight Morganas.
*ALARM*
Well put, sir.
Let's keep the Iku-Turso talk to ourselves though.
@BATTLE
Captain, I'm picking something up on the radar.
What is it?
I'm not sure. It's submerged, large, but it's movements don't match any submarine I know.
It's heading?
Directly for us... wait, it's changing course.
Hey, blue sail! Ready weapons.
If I'm understanding this right, that ship appears to be chasing whatever is submerged sir.
*ALARM*
Great.
Large Morgana force approaching fast, sir.
We don't have a choice. Bring us about to engage them.
@BATTLE
Captain, the remaining Morganas are fleeing.

Fields.MenuText: Well done.
And the submerged object?
What happened to the blue flagged ship?

Fields.DialogueText: Merci, Capitaine, but we've lost contact with the other vessels.
Gone, sir. Along with the flagged ship.
It left, sir, pursuing the submerged object.
There's a lot going on here I don't understand. I don't like that.
Hrm.
Something to say?
Can't decide if you are dumb or brave, staying in these waters with Iku-Turso on the prowl.

Fields.MenuText: Neither, just following orders.
Hopefully brave.
I don't believe in sea monsters.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, why are we entertaining him?
Sir, don't encourage him.
Or ancient gods or merpeople.
This is serious business, Captain. Iku-Turso is just waking up, so he's groggy. When he's ready the whole world is in trouble.
*ALARM*
Captain, incoming Morgana forces.
Prepare to defend our position.
You will listen, eventually. If they listened, you must.
Who?
Ready, sir?
Ready.
@BATTLE
Sir, the blue flag Morgana ship, it's approaching.
Ready our weapons.
Sir, they are hailing us.
Let me hear it.
Do not...fire...please?
Identify yourself.
Morgana vessel... Despair... we will not... attack.

Fields.MenuText: I don't believe you.
Why should we trust you?
What do you want?

Fields.DialogueText: You must.
We want... same.
To save.
I don't understand.
Explain yourself or make ready to fight!
We fight... Iku-Turso... stop it's eating... all.
Captain, Morgana ships approaching from our port. This is a trap!
*ALARM*
No trap... trust... defend self.
Bring us around and keep an eye on that ship.
Despair is retreating, sir.
Then let's deal with these other Morganas.
@BATTLE
Captain, I don't believe this Despair.
I admit, I half-wonder if it's Mischief or Delusion. But if there's any chance it could be a source of intelligence...
They're Morganas, sir. They are deceiving us, and we should attack them without hesitation.

Fields.MenuText: You may be right.
I'm not sure.
No, I want to know what's going on.

Fields.DialogueText: Permission to fire on sight?
I am.
Don't underestimate them, sir.
Are you incapable of learning?
I suggest we throw him overboard as well, sir.
We are not incapable, no. Why?
If it is new or unknown, you reject it. One cannot learn like this.
They're a Morgana. We know enough.
They are trying to destroy a greater evil, which is more than I can say for you lot.
How do you know that?
*ALARM*
Focus, Suffren. Morganas incoming.
Yessir.
@BATTLE
Captain, It's Despair. They are under attack.
Correct me if I'm wrong, but those are Morgana ships attacking them.
You're not wrong, sir.

Fields.MenuText: I still need answers from them, so defend Despair.
We have to help them.
Why?

Fields.DialogueText: Yessir, but I would like it noted that I strongly disagree.
Sir, why not let them fight it out?
Who cares, sir? Let them destroy each other.
I don't want Despair destroyed just yet. Let's go.
Yessir.
@BATTLE
Vessel Despair, do you read me?
Yes... what is phrase? ... Gratitude?
Thank you? Merci?
... Thank you.
Sir, she is retreating.
Despair, hold your position! Suffren, can we pursue?
No, Capitaine, we cannot match their speed safely.
Fine, hold off. We'll see them again.
Sir, I am picking up something in the water, submerged. I believe it is the same object we saw earlier.
And there is Despair.
They're firing on it, sir.
Brave creatures, attacking Iku-Turso without abandon.
They're hailing us sir.
We kill... Iku-Turso.
Why do you believe that is Iku-Turso.
Stange man... he shows us... taught us.
Aleksi?
I don't know. You know what, it's probably my brother over there.
*ALARM*
Captain, large Morgana force. They are heading for Despair.
Help us? ... Please?

Fields.MenuText: We will. Suffren, intercept the Morganas.
Suffren, we need to try and detain Despair.
We'll destroy them, but we are not helping you.

Fields.DialogueText: Yessir.
Bringing us around, sir.
That's right!
@BATTLE
Killed! Gutted! Iku-Turso's blood!
Despair, we want you to surrender.
We want... to KILL. KILL YOU ALL... but... wE... wIlL nOt.
Sir, they're retreating.
Are they in firing range?
They are but, sir, under the circumstances...
I agree. Let them go.
That's the last section of our search grid, isn't it?
Yessir, it looks like Lintukoto isn't here.
After all of that, just a rumor.
Unless we missed it somehow?
Could we have?
No, sir, unless it is a magical moving island.

Fields.MenuText: Well how would we find a moving island?
At this point, I may believe something like that.
Very funny, Suffren.

Fields.DialogueText: I was joking, sir.
I actually wouldn't blame you Captain.
Well, did we just see an ancient god die?
I think we both need a long rest.
*ALARM*
You were saying?
Maybe they are heading somewhere else?
Sir.
I know, I know. Move to intercept.
@BATTLE
Well, Captain, it's been fun, but it looks like it's time for me to say goodbye.
Care to explain anything?
Uhmmmm. I suppose so. I told a few, tiny lies.
You don't say?
Iku-Turso didn't really wake up, that was just a common sea creature Despair was hunting, possibly a whale. I can be very persuasive.

Fields.MenuText: You shouldn't play with people's lives like that.
So the whole thing was a lie. Why?
So you did all of this just to see if we would work together?

Fields.DialogueText: I wasn't playing at all. I was proving a point. Morganas and humans can work together.
Why do you think? You worked together. Can you believe it?
Humans and Morganas working together. I would say that is worth it.
*ALARM*
It was a fluke.
Maybe you're right, maybe not. Either way, Despair sacrificed a lot. They won't be rejoining to the other Morganas any time soon.
When they decide to attack humans again, we will stop them.
Fortunately, they've agreed to stay with me at Lintukoto for now.
Lintukoto!?
Sorry, Captain, there's only so much room. No invitation for you. Don't worry, though, the whole vast resources was a lie too.
Let me guess, your brother spread that rumor?
Brother? I don't have a brother.
*ALARM*
Okay, goodbye, strange man. Morganas, sir.
Good luck.
Let's go.
@BATTLE
Captain, you made it.
When have I missed your playing? What is this?
The Suffrettes, sir. They have a few bits they'd like to do.
But...
I've agreed to let them keep their club as long as they keep it appropriate.
Ha! You still manage to surprise.
Besides, I heard a little rumor that you came up with the name.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I... no, I was just joking and...

Fields.DialogueText: Save it, sir. I'll get you back.
Anyway. How are you feeling? Having any trouble getting into a performing state of mind after all the fighting?
Oh, no, Captain, nothing like a battle to loosen up my music muscle.
You're an odd one, Suffren.
And you're normal, Capitaine?
You tell me.
Don't tempt me.

Fields.MenuText: I had nothing to do with it.
Catchy, isn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: I will try to believe you.
Catchy? Oh, it will catch up to you.
